data.title: What Was This Weird Program?
data.meta_description: I had left the TV on the other night( round about Tuesday) whilst on the net, and when I switched off there was the program on about midnight and a woman...

#1

I had left the TV on the other night( round about Tuesday) whilst on the net, and when I switched off there was the program on about midnight and a woman was introducing clips from horror, martial arts, sexy, films and a naked woman telling jokes ????

#4

Hi,

Yep, the programme was indeed "OutThere". It's basically a late-night clips show, introduced by a female character called "Eden" - real name Miss Anneka Svenska.

She airs really unusual, cool, bizarre, grotesque, horrifying, hilarious and downright odd clips from the kinds of culty films that the average cinema-goer doesn't know of or doesn't care for.

Basically, it's like the "Eurotrash" or "Mondo Macabro" of the movie world. Good late-night viewing, and this is the third series now!

Here's Miss Svenska's website link:

CLICK ON ME!

Pooch

#7

Originally posted by PoochJD

introduced by a female character called "Eden" - real name Miss Anneka Svenska.

It's presented by Emily Booth now. She used to co-present "Bits" and appears in several low budget UK-made horror movies like Alex Chandon's Cradle of Fear and Pervirella, neither of which are any good but we won't hold that against Ms Booth. She was also in Nigel Wingrove's nunsploitation flick Sacred Flesh, which was a bit better than Chandon's crap films but not much.

She's far better looking than the oogly guys that put OutThere together and she's got a bit more personality than Anneka Svenska that used to present the show for the first couple of series. She looks great naked too (how she ends up in most of her films)
